Still, I wasn’t entirely convinced. The only thing that’s fun to slide back-and-forth indefinitely is a lounging cat on a smooth kitchen worktop. Still, after messing around with Sliding Hero’s Steam demo, I think this one might have much longer legs than its restrictive-sounding concept suggests. All the better to endlessly slide with.
 
Read more
articles.title: Sliding Hero turns a contentious puzzle type into an otherworldly jaunt through a cursed Venetian carnival

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
At some point every proud ruler must ask themselves the question: what should I do with all this stupid, tiresome civilisation I've built? Do I let it spin on forever, a gleaming machine of prosperity bathed in an eternal twilight, or do I, as the case may be, unleash a horde of voluptuous hellwomen to gather spirit energy for the resurrection of my tragically slain beloved? If you picked option B you should probably play My Lovely Empress, a plush empire management sim with a dastardly twist, from Indonesian team GameChanger Studio. Find a trailer below.
 
Read more
articles.title: In dark kingdom sim My Lovely Empress you run an empire with the help of summoned demon ladies

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
It is I, the wound salter. The injury insult adder. Life By You, the simulation life-em-up from Paradox, was canceled in June after being delayed indefinitely. The day after the cancellation - which Paradox CEO Fredrik Wester implied was down to a “lacking”, unfixable development state - designer Willem Delventhal spoke about his time at the subsequently shuttered Paradox Tectonic. He claimed the team spent a month “in purgatory” prior to being told of the game’s cancelation and studio shuttering two weeks before launch, despite being told by higher-ups that work was “exceeding expectations.”
We’ve now got another look at a game we’ll likely never get, thanks to a thread by Twxbbly user SimMattically collating unseen screenshots from portfolios by several artists who worked on Life By You.
 
Read more
articles.title: New screenshots from canceled Paradox sim Life By You show off all the fits we’ll never get

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Facebook and Oculus Rift owners Meta are reportedly closing Ready At Dawn Studios, the outfit behind the excellent Echo VR and Lone Echo games, as part of wider reductions at the company's Reality Labs division.
 
Read more
articles.title: Meta reportedly close Ready At Dawn, creators of some of the best VR games

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Fallout London launched late last month, but the huge, long in-development mod is so buggy Nic had to abandon his attempts to play it. Its developers have already promised hotfixes, and now say a "huge" update is also on the way.

 
Read more
articles.title: Fallout London's developers working on "huge" patch to come after its hotfixes

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
ODDADA is a music maker where every level looks like a colourful toy, some shaped like towers, or landscapes, or old factories. By stacking blocks, twisting knobs and clicking chunky buttons, you create your own track - then record it to a cassette tape you can keep.

It now has a release date: August 15th.

 
Read more
articles.title: Musical exploration toy ODDADA will launch next week

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
There seems to be a wave of retro racers around recently, and each one seems to pick a particular target to shoot with its nostalgia gun, whether Wipeout or Lotus or Micro Machines or whatever else. 

Maybe I'm forgetting some classic arcade racer, but Victory Heat Rally feels less laser targeted and more a modern take on the spirit of the genre. It's a 2.5D, "neo super scaler" arcade racer with split screen, drifting, car tuning and a lot of pep.

 
Read more
articles.title: Victory Heat Rally looks like an electrifying retro arcade racer, and it's releasing this winter

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
UK arts and entertainment union Equity have unveiled a raft of "best practice guidelines" for video game developers hiring voice actors, including some suggested minimum rates that are designed to address "systemic low pay" for performers. Other measures are designed to improve voice actor working conditions, and stop companies using their voices and likeness as fuel for generative AI tools without their consent. It's both a praiseworthy endeavour and an interesting breakdown of the voice-actor's trade.
 Read more
articles.title: UK video game voice actor's union proposes new minimum rates and protections against AI and abusive NDAs

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Former Ubisoft and Eidos-Montréal developer Stevan Anastasoff has announced Tales from the Mabinogion, a third-person narrative game based on ancient Welsh folklore that's written primarily in the Welsh language. The game puts you in charge of a wandering monarch, who is embarked on a quest to save the realm from a horrible fog. Find a trailer below. Yes, there are English subtitles.
 
Read more
articles.title: Former Assassin's Creed and Warhammer Online dev announces new fantasy game based on Welsh myth

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Dead Space developer and Striking Distance co-founder Glen Schofield left Striking Distance last September, following lower-than-hoped sales and mixed reviews for the studio's debut project The Callisto Protocol. Now, he's back to share a little about the horror game's difficult development, offering details of cut materials, a complicated relationship with parent company Krafton, the impact of Covid, and abandoned plans for a sequel.

 
Read more
articles.title: There should be a Callisto Protocol 2, says Dead Space creator Glen Schofield: "we had to cut two and a half bosses"

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
What if the company that sold your cheese also sold your PC gaming hardware? This is not the murmuring of some poor sod on a nineteen-hour Dota 2 binge who’s started thinking that the crumbs in his keyboard resemble a viable snack, but a bold new reality, one I recently found myself staring down during a trip to Asda. The supermarket chain – third biggest in the UK by turnover and purveyors of ill-fitting clothes and surprisingly good doughnuts alike – has added light-up gaming mice, keyboards, and headsets to its mountain of own-brand wares.
Asda being what it is (Americans, if you’re unfamiliar, think Walmart with less gun violence), it’s all dirt cheap as well. £17 for a full-size keyboard. £16 for an FPS mouse. Overwhelmed with curiosity, I ended up taking home a complete starter set (keeb, different mouse, headset, and mousemat) for £45, or about a third of the price of the Logitech G515 Lightspeed TKL that I’d shortly kick off my desk. Could this be a new frontier in affordable PC hardware, bringing tech to the masses in a way no specialist retailer ever could, or should supermarkets stick to cereal and meal deals? Surely the Asda Tech (real name) 4-in-1 Gaming Kit would have the answers.
Read more
articles.title: I spent a week using supermarket own-brand gaming peripherals, and suggest that you don’t

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Hmmm... it could be nothing, but the technomancers at Nvidia have just updated their graphics drivers, and among the list of game profiles now listed in their control panel tool is Final Fantasy XVI. The blockbuster JRPG isn't out on PC yet, and developers Square Enix have not given a concrete release date for it, but this does seem to be prep work for the inevitable. And with Squeenix in attendance at Gamescom, it's possible we'll know more soon. 
Read more
articles.title: Nvidia have added a Final Fantasy XVI driver profile, fuelling PC release hopes

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
My own experience with gambling doesn't extend much beyond the single time I won a few dollars at a Vegas slot machine then refused to play again so I could claim that I'd "beaten Vegas." My own very petty victory as the ultimate gambler aside, it's by and large an industry built on preying on the vulnerable, so it's no surprise that Balatro developer LocalThunk is so dead against ever seeing his poker puzzler used for evil that he's made a specific stipulation in his will.
Read more
articles.title: You won’t be seeing the Balatro IP used by casinos or gambling companies - the developer has forbidden it in his will

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Back in June, strategy bods Creative Assembly put out a chunky, chatty video discussing the next expansion for Total War: Warhammer 3. Aside from a not-so-subtle hint that the orcs, ogres, and Khorne pack would feature at least one colossal squig, it also ended with a tease at smaller bits of new content coming alongside regular patches. As of the game’s latest hotfix blog, we’ve now got a better idea when we’ll start seeing some of these “smaller bits and pieces.” Bits and pieces? In this economy? Yes, and this month in fact. “Late August” to be precise by quoting a vague statement precisely.
Read more
articles.title: Total War Warhammer 3 teases new content this month, and a hotfix ensures goblins will now get dismembered correctly

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
In the grim darkness of the far future, there is only War, unless you don't have a 64-bit PC with an Intel Core i5-8600K equivalent and at least eight gigs of RAM, in which case you'll have to, I don't know, live in everlasting peace, or something. I'm pretty sure not having eight gigs of RAM is heretical, but never fear, you can probably compensate by taking a leaf from the God-Emperor's book and arrange for a host of dying psykers to pour their brain energy into your motherboard.
All of which is to say that Focus Home have released the system requirements for huge-shouldered action game Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2. Find them proudly emblazoned across the header image above, and written out for easier copy-pasting in the blockquote, below.
 Read more
articles.title: Omnissiah be praised, Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2's system requirements are here

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
As the wait lengthens for Hollow Knight: Silksong, other Soulsy creature features are scurrying to fill the breach. We had Deviator last week - now, it's time for a bumper helping of the heebie-jeebies in the shape of Perennial Order. The title makes it sound like an eBay delivery of potted geraniums. The game festering beneath is actually a "plant horror" boss rusher with twin stick melee controls, unlockable "Instinct" abilities and one-hit deaths.
In a gift to headline writers everywhere, the developers, four-person Gardenfiend Games, are calling it "Hollow Knight meets Titan Souls", and who am I to deny them? It's got one of those "painterly" art styles, too, though other words come to mind, such as "rotted" and "unhallowed" and "manky". It's out on 6th September. Find a trailer nested below this paragraph like a venus flytrap poised to clamp around your fingers.

 
Read more
articles.title: Plant horror boss rusher Perennial Order is an oozing hybrid of Hollow Knight and Titan Souls

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Okay, listen. The Roads To Power expansion coming to Crusader Kings III is focusing on the Byzantine Empire. But forget that. Because today developers Paradox revealed the ins and outs of another feature from the DLC that is way more exciting than some fusty old Greeks. It's called "landless adventurers" and it'll let you play as disgraced dirtbag travelling the world in a sort of medieval gig economy. You'll be making camp, gathering followers, taking random jobs from local rulers, and catching infectious diseases as you try to travel safely through war-torn regions. It sounds amazing.
Read more
articles.title: Crusader Kings 3's "landless adventurers" are set to offer a whole new way of playing the medieval trouble sim

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I don't play much Call Of Duty any more. My feelings about the series have settled back from self-righteous fury over its Pentagon-sponsored war-fellating to a quieter, regretful sense that there have maybe been enough Call Of Duty games now, and that it would be nice if we could fill that infamous late October/early November release slot with, I don't know, games about witches instead, or maybe just turn it into a public holiday and spend the week lying on a mattress regarding the ceiling. Still: I've skinned and filleted enough COD in my time to know that Black Ops 6's new "omnimovement" system is going to ruffle as many feathers as it smooths. The short version is that it turns you into Max Payne.
 
Read more
articles.title: Black Ops 6 leak gives naughty players access to the Max Payne-ish omnimovement system for the first time

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
In his Vampire Survivors review, Matt Cox described the game as something he could play with "one hand in a packet of crisps". I think about this quite often, actually, as someone whose largely offline friends (or Fortnite/FIFA pals) ask me to recommend them a game that's good or interesting. Show them something popular like Elden Ring and, despite its grandeur, it might prove too much in all facets. But Vampire Survivors? It's an easy sell: simple, digestible, ridiculous value.
All of this is to say, One BTN Bosses is from the same school of the easy sell. You can fight bosses with one hand in a packet of pickled onion Space Raiders, after all.
Read more
articles.title: One BTN Bosses' rhythmic rush is an easy sell, since you can play it with one hand in a packet of crisps

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
You’re dead at the start of rhythm-combat  RPG Nocturne, just arrived in some sort of afterlife waiting room after the apparent extinction of humanity. You get your bearings, and you soon meet up with another, only slightly irritating, small child. His name is Kimothy, which sounds like something you’d only say as a joke to annoy friends named Kim, and then only once because it would be stupid to say it again. It’s fine! Leaves flutter, rays of sun cavort through trees, and the music is utterly gorgeous. The game opens on twinkly piano and mournful strings, infused with a good dose of stirring JRPG whimsy, and soon transforms into whatever the genre of music is called that makes you want to immediately go on a massive adventure. Potion-punk. Slime-swing. Limit breakcore etc.
Read more
articles.title: Chrono Trigger meets Guitar Hero was not on my bingo card, but I’ll take it regardless

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Is early adoption a chump’s game? I dunno about that, though between the Asus ROG Ally X and the Steam Deck OLED, those who stayed their hand on their earlier handheld gaming PC counterparts do have a couple of quality second-genners to choose from. Valve’s effort manages to wring multiple performance, design, and battery life improvements out of its new display, while the ROG Ally X makes similar upgrades with a bigger-yet-better take on the original ROG Ally.
The only thing to do, clearly, is make them fight. It’s probably in the Irish Code Duello or something: "Should one portable games box impugn another’s honour by releasing shortly after it, satisfaction must be claimed through a comparison article." My hands are bound here, folks, though if you yourself have been playing the waiting game on a handheld purchase, perhaps this little head-to-head can help you pick the right one.
Read more
articles.title: Asus ROG Ally X vs Steam Deck OLED: battle of the beefed-up handhelds

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Cinematic platformer Bionic Bay opens on a scene of a very large egg doing very bad things - easily my third favourite genre of speculative fiction. You awake to a world of tree trunks that twist like viscera and corroded contraptions powered by luminous goop that’s stored in the balls, uh, big glass orbs. A beam of light soon fills your character with newfound vigour, which is a nice moment of triumph in what otherwise feels like a deeply oppressive rust pit, all unsteady platforms and jagged pipes.
It doesn’t take long before you start spotting examples of the reason Bionic Bay went viral earlier this week. Above your head hangs a painstakingly detailed mass of vents and cables, looming lifelike with dust and shadow and history. I stood and stared because I’d seen how the sausage was made, but I like to think I would have lingered longer than usual anyway. It really is just that impressive.
Read more
articles.title: Cinematic platformer Bionic Bay is incredibly impressive even beyond its 250,000 pixel trees

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
This week sees the release of a new Steam edition of Type-Moon and Kinoko Nasu's dark fantasy visual novel and dating sim Fate Stay/Night. I randomly watched one of Stay/Night's many anime spin-offs, Fate Zero, during the pandemic lockdowns. It triggered a short-lived obsession with the Fate series - I even dipped a toe in the long-lived mobile gacha game Fate/Grand Order. As such, I think I'm the nearest thing RPS has to a Fate "expert". Join me for a brief and sporadically informed tour of a universe that has Shaped The Culture like few others.
 
Read more
articles.title: One of the most influential Japanese visual novels ever made gets a PC Steam remaster this week

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Star Wars Outlaws is out relatively soon and looks relatively exciting, if you're into Ubisoft open worlds and pseudo-Uncharted mechanics with pewpews and dribbly aliens. And if you're excited, prepare to get more excited-er - or more exhausted-er - as Ubi have just unveiled Outlaws' DLC plans for season pass holders. Those DLCs will let you meet "notorious gambler" Lando Calrissian and "veteran pirate" Hondo Ohnaka, who I am definitely familiar with.
Read more
articles.title: Star Wars Outlaws gets two story DLCs featuring Lando and Hondo, but only if you fork out for a special edition

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
What is it with monstrous eating mechanics in games of late? Last week it was carnivorous post-Soviet elevators, now it’s retro fantasy RPGs that devour themselves. In Super Dungeon Muncher, you are a teeny-tiny hero navigating a corridor-shaped map full of fireball traps and crumbling platforms, spinning coins and patrolling critters. That’s the “Super Dungeon” part. The “Muncher” part refers to the corpulent red monster guzzling the whole level in your wake.
  
Read more
articles.title: In cute throwback RPG Super Dungeon Muncher the dungeon is being eaten by a monster

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Every so often, the fine folk of Resetera take a break from their usual schedule of complaining that video games journalists get all their news from Resetera, and post a Thing Of Beauty. For example: it's thanks to Resetera member AstralSphere that I know about Alistair Aitcheson's Magic Box and BizHawk retro emulation tools, which - amongst other things - allow you to play old Sonic the Hedgehog games in giddy parallel, shuffling between them whenever you collect a ring.
 Read more
articles.title: Please incorporate this absurd game-shuffling Sonic mod into every other video game

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
The monst! The monst are back! Whoo-hoo! We’re still a while off from the TBC 2025 release date of haute-couture-asaurus RPG Monster Hunter Wilds, and Capcom have finally graced us with some delicious Actual Details, following the previous cinematic trailers. These come in the form of three short videos uploaded today on the official Monster Hunter channel, detailing the basics, focus mode, and the great sword's moveset.
Read more
articles.title: Capcom show off precise aiming, wound highlights, and focus mode in new Monster Hunter Wilds reveals

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
As reported by Gematsu yesterday, SEGA have filed a trademark in Japan for the term “Yakuza Wars”. This happened on July 26th, and while Gematsu speculate this might be related to the next game in the Yakuza: Like A Dragon series, I have other plans. For the imaginary game. That I have nothing to do with.
Read more
articles.title: New SEGA trademark “Yakuza Wars” is probably not a Total War: Like A Dragon game, but let's speculate wildly anyway

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
As Hamlet requested of Horatio, it is time to absent myself from felicity awhile, and in this harsh world draw my breath in pain to tell you that the Half-Life 3 speculators are at it again. Over the weekend, the discovery of a mystery Valve project called "White Sands" on a voice actor's portfolio has set tongues and fingers wagging about potential Half-Life news in the offing.
Read more
articles.title: Valve "White Sands" project spotted on Starfield voice actor portfolio, prompting Half-Life speculation

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
One of the neat things about Norland's fantasy medievalism is that specialist knowledge is tied to characters. So if there's only one person in your village who knows how to brew tastier beer, and they die after being freakishly savaged by a passing wolf (it happens), suddenly your village will have no artisanal lager master. The results may be devastating. Luckily, you can share knowledge in a number of ways - by copying books, or having "wise conversations". The exception to this is child characters, whose pea-sized brains can't learn specialist knowledge, only soaking up basic attributes like "manners" from the teachers you assign to them. Well, until now. The developers for the Rimworld-meets-Crusader Kings catastrophe simulator have made kids a little smarter. They'll now learn more important things from their adult teachers.
Read more
articles.title: Children in Norland can now learn pig farming from their elders, the little idiots

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Flippin’ heck, what a journey it’s been for Baldur's Gate 3, eh? It seems just yesterday I was getting very jealous at Matthew Castle (RPS in peace) for getting to preview the sequel to my beloved Shadows Of Amn. Fast forward several turns, Larian’s RPG banger is officially one year old since release, and there’s now a much higher chance that strangers at pubs will understand why my failed romance with Jaheira as a youth was such a deeply heartbreaking experience. Baldur’s Gate 3 itself looks to be done and dusted following the upcoming patch, but Larian now seem to be gearing up for their next charm offensive with a new “community focused” YouTube channel, as well as further teasing their two games currently in development.
Read more
articles.title: Baldurs Gate 3 devs tease future non-D&D games, say morale is “super high”: “we're doing our own thing again"

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I write this week's list of new PC games in a spirit of terror, for a strange man is at my window with a ladder. Has Santa Claus come early? Have Sony's goons found me at last, after swearing vengeance for that 8/10 I handed God Of War 3 as a cub reporter? Does the motion detector on the light over the apartment block door need fixing? There is no time to enquire and certainly no time to flee, for there are video games we must discuss.
 Read more
articles.title: The Maw: what's new in PC games this week?

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Hello reader who is also a reader, and welcome back to Booked For The Week - our regular Sunday chat with a selection of cool industry folks about books! July has shrivelled up like a freshly laundered sock left on the radiator for too long, and yet, it's still hot enough that even typing the word radiator makes me want to inject concentrated Solero straight into my bloodstream. With my last remaining un-fugged brain cells, I have wrenched this column back from its hiatus, and who better than to get us into the swing of things once more than Baldur’s Gate 3 lead writer and bloody RPS legend Adam Smith! Cheers Adam! Mind if we have a nose at your bookshelf?
Read more
articles.title: What's on your bookshelf?: Baldur's Gate 3 lead writer Adam Smith

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Sundays are for doing a little dance in the kitchen. Go on. No-one’s watching. Raise that tin opener to the roof. Before you get carried away and fling errant globules of mushy pea all over your freshly sponged worktops, let’s read this week’s best writing about games (and game related things!)
Read more
articles.title: The Sunday Papers

articles.author: Ollie Toms
articles.description:
It's Saturday morning, everyone! Birds are swaying, the trees are singing. Time to celebrate all the ways in which we'll be staying indoors staring at screens. I've given the outside world a go, but it feels a bit unbalanced, a bit glitchy. I think I'll wait until they've added a bit more content. So here's what we'll all be clicking on this weekend!
 Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this weekend?

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I've never learned to drive, but every so often a well-meaning friend tells me I'd be good at it, because 'look, Edwin, you play all those driving games, surely they've taught you the basics'. Friend, here is what driving games have taught me: traffic lights are there for regional flavour; drifting is the same thing as cornering; other cars exist to serve as bumper cushions when overshooting a turn. Certainly, nobody wants a guy whose ideas about automobiles come from 2018's Wreckfest to be involved in the school run. On which note: THQ Nordic have just announced Wreckfest 2 - a fresh helping of destruction derby with fancified visuals and newly animate drivers who flinch and gesticulate when other drivers smash into them. Witness the carnage in the announcement trailer below.
 
Read more
articles.title: Wreckfest 2 announced with trailer abundant in fender-bending and newly rageful drivers

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
It's a hell of a thing to showcase a remake weeks after kiboshing the developers of the original game. In early July, Gothic creators Piranha Bytes were reportedly shuttered as part of Embracer Group's mad race to trim costs, following their decade-long acquisition binge. Watching THQ Nordic's new Gothic Remake trailer, below, feels a little like watching a vivisectionist parade about in somebody else's skin. Still, the remake's developers Alkimia Interactive aren't to blame for Embracer's fuck-ups, and I am selfishly happy to see Gothic return as an Unreal Engine 5 production - even if I didn't play the original back in 2001.


Sin did play the original game, and in her 2016 retrospective, she paints an absorbing picture of a dark fantasy "microsociety" in which every community "has a reason to exist, a means of providing for itself, a social order, and a long term goal". It's a setup that reminds me of my beloved Roadwarden, even as the sight of grumpy lizards slinking through undergrowth has me silently mouthing "fus roh dah".
 
Read more
articles.title: Gothic Remake gameplay overview reveals an eccentric open world RPG that still feels like the future

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Titan Quest 2! Now there's a name you can set your watch by. No colons, no bespoke jargon, no tortuous subtitles like "Gaia's B.O.U.N.T.Y." or "Hyperion's Wild Rumpus" - just the steadying prospect of a titanic quest that, who knows, may involve actual titans. The action-RPG beneath the moniker appears similarly straightforward: it's about following a plot thread through a mythological world in top-down view, smashing Ancient Greek giga-crabs and the like to obtain shinier, pointier varieties of gear. I'm sure I don't need to tell you that there's an endgame in which you farm monsters for crafting materials.


Like Pandora opening her box, but without the accompanying tidal wave of sickness, curses and death, THQ Nordic have released a new trailer that talks you though all of this in detail. Here it is...

 
Read more
articles.title: Titan Quest 2 sure looks like that brighter, breezier action-RPG you Diablo 4 haters were gunning for

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Bungie have reportedly cancelled Payback, an unannounced project in the Destiny universe from former Destiny 2 game director Luke Smith and project lead Mark Noseworthy. Both Noseworthy and Smith appear to have lost their jobs in the course of Bungie's brutal cost-cutting this week, but Payback's cancellation pre-dates the layoffs. Envisaged as a Destiny spin-off, rather than Destiny 3, it was apparently dropped "a while ago".
 Read more
articles.title: Destiny 3 may yet happen, but Destiny's unannounced "Payback" spin-off won't, according to reports

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
The first World Of Goo was a cheerful parade of goopy engineering with a sense of never-ending novelty (well, never-ending for about four hours). Every level would introduce a new goo type or a twist on the basic bridge-building puzzle that challenged you to get a gaggle of gurgling balls to the nearest pipe. World Of Goo 2 pursues that sense of novelty with just as much twitchy eagerness as its predecessor, throwing new toys and goos at the player in an effort to keep you on your sludge-coated toes. That pursuit doesn't always result in pleasing new levels, though. There is a "hit and miss" feeling to things this time around. But those hits are hits. For anyone who has spent the last 16 years yearning for more sticky structure-building: I hope you like comically unpredictable fluids.
Read more
articles.title: World Of Goo 2 review: an inventive return to goo with some flies in the ointment

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
"Again, but better" has become the maxim of post-Steam Deck portable PCs. Or, to be more specific, post-Steam Deck OLED ones. Now that Valve have shown it’s possible to quickly turn around an upgraded handheld without enraging owners of the original, Lenovo have hinted at a new Legion Go, MSI have revealed an improved Claw, and Asus have released this here ROG Ally X. A ROG Ally, again – but better? Yes, it is, in almost every way except the speed at which it’ll plunge you into financial destitution.
Read more
articles.title: Asus ROG Ally X review: the best Windows handheld, if you can afford it

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Toonsouls, which you can find on Steam here, doesn’t appear to screenshot especially well. Don’t get me wrong, I’m a big fan of those perpetually disgruntled ghosts and charming goofskulls, but I might not be writing about the platform game at all if I hadn’t seen it in motion, where the vision comes together a lot more. The Cuphead influence runneth so overly that it feels trite to even point it out, and I do think maybe opting for different music would have served it far better in this case, but you can’t deny that Ghosts n’ Goblins lance throw. Get stuck in.
Read more
articles.title: Toonsouls is the Dark Souls of Cuphead, in case you’ve got one of two solid gold games journalism jokes raring to go

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Jail shake-and-breaker management sim Prison Architect 2 has been delayed indefinitely, a couple of months after publishers Paradox parted ways with original developers Double Eleven. Current developers Kokku will use the additional time "to improve both the game's performance and its content". Additionally, Paradox are removing the option to preorder the game until they have a "robust" release timeline. Existing preorders on all platforms will be refunded, and all preorder-exclusive items will be added into the base game.
 Read more
articles.title: Paradox delay Prison Architect 2 and cancel preorders: "improving the performance has proven to be a task that will take time"

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
With Valorant, Riot set out to integrate a bit of hero shooter into the Counter Strike template and made it a little more accessible than CS in the process. Now Mountaintop Studios, a new studio whose ranks include ex-Bungie and Respawn devs, have chucked themselves into the tactical FPS gauntlet with Spectre Divide. Made with input from former CS pro and streamer Shroud, it looks a bit like a mix of CS and Valorant, but has a big gimmick that sets it apart from the two: you can swap between two bodies. I… am cautiously optimistic? I think?
Read more
articles.title: Spectre Divide is a new tactical shooter with one big gimmick: controlling two bodies at once

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
This week's mass layoffs at Destiny studio Bungie were planned out months ago, former employees have told journalist Stephen Totilo at Game File (paywalled). According to Totilo, Bungie leadership "overstated their studio’s financial prospects to Sony" after the latter bought Bungie in 2022 for $3.6 billion. The latest cuts were necessary to prevent continued losses, says the report, after Bungie missed Sony’s targets following the release of last year’s Lightfall.
Read more
articles.title: Bungie layoffs “couldn't be avoided” even if Destiny 2 The Final Shape had "blockbuster performance”, says report

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Nailgun-toting FEAR-meets-GZDoom FPS Selaco is now Steam Deck Verified, allowing you to either impress or appal fellow train commuters with your knack for pixel splatter. That's not all: developers Altered Orbit Studios have outlined planned features for the next round of updates. They include backpacks that considerately replenish your weapons, fresh story material, a tune-up for the enemy AI in the game's second chapter, and a "Randomizer" system that scrambles spawns and pick-ups while introducing weapon rarities, for beaucoup replay value.  
 
Read more
articles.title: Noisy shooter Selaco is Steam Deck verified with new story stuff, AI improvements and "Randomizer" modes in the works

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Obsidian's first-person action-RPG Avowed is one of our 75 most anticipated games of 2024, but according to a report, it's been booted back into early 2025 to avoid a "very busy period" on Microsoft's Game Pass subscription service. Thanks, Microsoft. Do you know how long it took to cobble together that 2024 list? I still get hand cramps.
 Read more
articles.title: Avowed's release delayed into 2025 to dodge "a busy season" on Game Pass, claims report

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
THQ Nordic have announced The Eternal Life Of Goldman, a hand-drawn platformer from This Is The Police and Hollywood Animal devs Weappy. I caught a brief presentation earlier in the week and yeah, this seems promising. On the one hand, it reminds me of cheery 16-bit hop 'n' boppers like, say, the Mega Drive adaptation of Disney's Aladdin. On the other, it makes me think of side-scrolling Soulslikes (Scroulslikes?) such as Blasphemous and the frantic worldbuilding of Rick & Morty.
 
Read more
articles.title: The Eternal Life Of Goldman is a gorgeous, nightmare throwback to classic 16-bit platformers

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Lukáš Kotek)
articles.description: Provozovat FreeDOS ve virtuálním stroji už umíme. Následující text popisuje retro notebook Pocket 386, zprovoznění FreeDOSu na něm a množství drobných tipů a triků nejen ohledně české lokalizace.
articles.title: Pocket 386: FreeDOS na malém notebooku se spoustou konektorů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Na článek, v němž jsme se zabývali základní problematikou modelů provádějících klasifikaci dat, dnes navážeme. Ukážeme si jeden z modelů, jenž namísto klasifikace provádí regresi. Jedná se o model lineární regresní analýzy.
articles.title: Balíček scikit-learn: modely provádějící regresní analýzu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Sonda do světa otevřeného softwaru. Dnes si představíme aplikaci pro vyhledávání obsahu souborů, vyzkoušíme kalkulačku z Windows na Linuxu, řekneme si o novém webovém prohlížeči a zazálohujeme si systém.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (14. 8. 2024): hledejte v obsahu svých souborů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Po popisu standardních textových i grafických režimů karty VGA se zaměříme na popis režimů nestandardních. Bude se z velké části jednat o různé úpravy grafického režimu 13H s rozlišením 320×200 pixelů a s 256 barvami.
articles.title: Nestandardní grafické režimy karty VGA

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: CESNET CERTS)
articles.description: V dnešním díle Postřehů se podíváme na zranitelnost 0.0.0.0 Day, ztrátu dat z tisíců školních zařízení, ransomware BlackSuit, zranitelnost v PostgreSQL a další zajímavosti z uplynulého týdne.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: zranitelnost 0.0.0.0 Day a ztráta dat z tisíců školních zařízení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Komunita kolem Manjaro Linuxu experimentuje s novým, neměnným obrazem operačního systému. Společnost Canonical oznámila velkou změnu v procesu výběru jádra pro budoucí vydání Ubuntu.
articles.title: Manjaro zkouší neměnný systém, Ubuntu mění přístup k jádru

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Souborové systémy v Linuxu 6.11: nejrychlejší XFS s Ext4, Bcachefs nadále zrychluje, vyšla vývojová verze Wine 9.15, Ryzeny 3000 dostanou řešení pro AMD P-State, Ladybird má nadaci a podporu AVIF či JXL.
articles.title: SVG kurzory v KDE, ovladač P-State i pro problematické Ryzeny 3000

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Bude stačit balík změn, které šéf Intelu představil? Nezařadí se Intel spolu s Boeingem po bok firem, které kdysi vládly světu a dnes jsou relevantní asi jako Kodak? Sahá si Intel na definitivní dno?
articles.title: Modlitba pro Intel: trápící se gigant a jeho radikální řez

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Na úvodní článek o datové analýze s využitím knihovny scikit-learn dnes navážeme. Ukážeme si práci s modely provádějícími klasifikaci dat. Konkrétně se bude jednat o modely, které se „učí s učitelem“ – supervised learning.
articles.title: Balíček scikit-learn: modely provádějící klasifikaci

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Sluka)
articles.description: Pravidelná středeční sonda do světa software. Dnes se podíváme na nástroj pro posílání HTTP požadavků, necháme zestárnout video nahrávky a nakonec vyzkoušíme pomocníka pro správu systemd jednotek.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (7. 8. 2024): posílejte vlastní požadavky pomocí HTTP

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Chcete se stát odborníky na monitoring pomocí systému Zabbix? Nabízíme pětidenní kurz Zabbix, který probíhá online a je zaměřen na řešení praktických problémů. Kurz je dotován Úřadem práce, od kterého můžete získat až 82 % ceny kurzu. Kontaktujte naši kolegyni pavla.hettnerova@iinfo.cz.
articles.title: Pětidenní kurz Zabbix dotovaný Úřadem práce

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost Intel prodala během druhého čtvrtletí celý svůj podíl ve společnosti Arm Holdings, jak vyplývá z úterní zprávy pro americkou Komisi pro cenné papíry. Společnost rovněž prodala svůj podíl ve společnosti ZeroFox, která se zabývá kybernetickou bezpečností, a snížila podíl ve společnosti Astera Labs, která vyvíjí platformy pro připojení firem.
articles.title: Intel prodal podíl ve společnosti Arm přibližně za 147 milionů dolarů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Americký Národní institut pro standardy a technologie (NIST) dnes zveřejnil dlouho očekávané standardy postkvantového šifrování, které mají chránit elektronické informace do vzdálené budoucnosti, kdy se dá očekávat, že kvantové počítače prolomí stávající kryptografické algoritmy. Už dlouho se hovoří o tom, že by takové stroje mohly být k dispozici za deset let.
articles.title: NIST dokončil trojici standardů postkvantového šifrování

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Distribuce Gentoo byla jednou z posledních linuxových distribucí, která stále ještě udržovala podporu pro architekturu Itanium (IA-64). Podpora v linuxovém světě ale postupně mizí na mnoha úrovních včetně jádra operačního systému nebo překladače GCC. Nyní i vývojáři Gentoo oznámili konec.
articles.title: Gentoo ukončuje podporu architektury Itanium IA-64

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Tři roky po původním vydání končí pravidelná bezpečnostní podpora Debianu 11 s kódovým označením Bullseye. Tým dlouhodobé podpory Debianu (LTS) převzal bezpečnostní podporu od týmů pro bezpečnost a pro vydání. Bullseye LTS bude podporován od 15. srpna 2024 do 31. srpna 2026.
articles.title: Bezpečnostní podpora pro Debian Bullseye předána týmu LTS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Až 256 procesorových jader typu RISC-V nabídne nově ohlášená produktová řada P870-D od RISC-V. Cílí pochopitelně na datacentra či obecně serverové využití. Vedle obvyklé výbavy SiFive hovoří explicitně o podpoře pro AI/HPC či podpoře CXL (Compute Express Link) a CHI chip to chip (C2C).
articles.title: SiFive ohlašuje 256jádrový RISC-V procesor P870-D, dostupnost ještě v roce 2024

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Na Open-Source Firmware Conference (OSFC) konané v německé Bochumi 3. až 5. září tohoto roku bude přítomna i AMD a dozvíme se nové detaily k dlouhodobým firemním plánům kolem open-source firmwarů. Řeč tedy bude o běžícím projektu openSIL, který jednoho dne nahradí dosud používaný systém AGESA.
articles.title: AMD podrobněji k openSIL začátkem září na konferenci

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nová řada telefonů Google Pixel 9 míří na český trh a jednotlivé modely se budou v distribuci postupně objevovat v nejbližších týdnech. Google zde nadále sází na osvědčenou konstrukci, OLED displeje, vlastní ARM SoC nové generace Tensor G4 s rychlejším zpracováním všeho včetně AI. Pixely 9 budou mimochodem softwarově podporovány 7 let.
articles.title: Google uvedl Pixel 9 / Pro / Pro XL, hodinky Pixel Watch 3 a sluchátka Pixel Buds Pro 2

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Proxmox je moderní virtualizační platforma, která v mnoha případech může nahradit VMware. Je open-source, zdarma a je postaven na otevřených technologiích jako KVM, LXC, CEPH a dalších. Pokud potřebujete provozovat virtualizaci, Proxmox je pro vás ideální stack a na našem workshopu Proxmox se dozvíte, jak na něj.
articles.title: Proxmox: moderní virtualizační platforma schopná nahradit VMware (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Hrach)
articles.description: Série esejí Situational awareness: The Decade Ahead od bývalého zaměstnance OpenAI (PDF, 165 stran) se zamýšlí nad možným scénářem nejbližšího vývoje umělé inteligence.
articles.title: Situační uvědomění: vývoj AI

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Hned dvě úpravy kódu zaměřující se na vlekoucí se bolístku desktopového prostředí GNOME jsou připraveny k testování. GNOME už nějakou dobu trpí za určitých okolností na trhající se kurzor myši, například v situacích, kdy se nic jiného na desktopu nehýbe.
articles.title: Vývojáři GNOME se zaměřují na trhající se kurzor myši

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Čerstvý kód do projektů ovladačů AGX Gallium3D a Honeykrisp vznikajících pod křídly Asahi Linuxu zase o kus silou svých 42 patchů posouvá kvalitu implementace OpenGL a Vulkan pro „Křemíky“ od Apple. Kód je součástí Gitové větve, z níž vzejde budoucí Mesa 24.3.
articles.title: Aktualizace OpenGL a Vulkan ovladačů pro Apple Silicon míří do Mesa 24.3

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Pravidelné nové vydání operačního systému Tails nepřináší mnoho novinek. Tvůrci aktualizovali webový prohlížeč Tor Browser na verzi 13.5.2 (staví na Firefoxu 115.14.0 ESR s backportovanými opravami z Firefoxu 129, plus novější verzi NoScript 11.4.31). Stejně tak pošťáka Thunderbird 115.14.0. Přehled aktualizovaných balíčků s firmwary je pak velmi, velmi obsáhlý.
articles.title: Tails 6.6 aktualizuje mnoho balíčků s firmwary

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Od verze FFmpeg 6.1 je v tomto balíku přítomna podpora hardwarově akcelerovaného dekódování videa skrze rozhraní Vulkan Video. Nyní do Gitu projektu přibyla podpora i pro kódování videa skrze Vulkan Video.
articles.title: FFmpeg nasazuje podporu kódování videa s Vulkan Video

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Vývojáři včera otevřeli hru Anodyne 2: Return to Dust. Je to 3D běhací a skákací hra, která používá Unity. Je stále dostupná na Steamu nyní (do 19 hodin) ještě ve slevě za 7,80 eur.
articles.title: Hra Anodyne 2 dává k dispozici zdrojové kódy

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Enrique Nissim a Krzysztof Okupski objevili novou zranitelnost procesorů AMD CVE-2023–31315 Sinkclose. Jedná se o zranitelnost v SMM (System Management Mode). Útočník s právy ring0 (jádro) může obejít zámek SMM a spustit libovolný kód s nejvyššími právy na x86 ring-2.
articles.title: Zranitelnost procesorů AMD Sinkclose, lokální zvýšení práv

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Začátkem roku jsme psali o tom, že organizace ICANN (Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers) zvažuje vyhrazení domény .internal pro soukromé využití v neveřejných sítích. Doména byla nakonec skutečně k těmto účelům vyhrazena a podobně jako privátní IP adresy podle RFC 1918 se tedy tato TLD nikdy neobjeví ve veřejném internetu.
articles.title: ICANN vyhradil doménu .internal pro použití v soukromých sítích

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: O problémech se stabilitou procesorů Intel 13. a 14. generace jsme tu nedávno psali. Intel vydal opravený mikrokód s označením „0×129“, ten by měl limitovat napájecí napětí pod 1,55 V. Podle Intelu by měl být vliv na výkon zanedbatelný.
articles.title: Výkonnostní dopad nového mikrokódu Intelu, který „řeší“ stabilitu procesorů 13. a 14. generace

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Inženýr Intelu Colin Ian King si všiml, že zarovnání ACPI objektů podle vyrovnávací paměti přináší rychlejší bootování. Při 100 bootech byla průměrná změna 35 ms. To sice není hodně, ale v kritických nasazeních to může pomoci.
articles.title: Změna jednoho řádku v jádře a boot je kratší o 35 ms

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Google DeepMind použilo průmyslovou robotickou ruku ABB IRB 1100 a naprogramovalo AI (ArsTechnica jej nazvala AlphaPong), aby robot hrál stolní tenis proti člověku. Proti oponentům, se kterými předtím nehrál, robot vyhrál 45 % zápasů z celkového počtu 29.
articles.title: AI od Google DeepMind hraje stolní tenis na amatérské úrovni

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: V současnosti se do Ubuntu dává jádro, které je poslední stabilní v okamžik kernel freeze. To ale znamená, že nové Ubuntu v okamžik vydání může mít jádro staré až 2 měsíce. To se nelíbí některým uživatelům, kteří by chtěli novější jádra s novými funkcemi.
articles.title: Ubuntu bude mít novější jádra

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: JavaScript, HTML a CSS jsou nepostradatelnou součástí každého webu. Tyto technologie jsou snadno pochopitelné a jednoduché webové stránky díky nim dokážeš vytvořit už za pár týdnů. Nepotřebuješ žádné předchozí znalosti, všechno tě naučíme v naší Front-end Developer Akademii během 14 týdnů.
articles.title: Staň se vývojářem front-endu během 14týdenní akademie (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Na serveru GOG.com je možné získat hru Intravenous zdarma. Jde o taktickou střílečku v pohledu ze shora.
articles.title: Hra zdarma na GOG.com Intravenous už jen dnes do 15 hodin

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Raspberry Pi Foundation představila nový jednodeskový počítač Raspberry Pi Pico 2. Jde o mikrokontrolér postavený na zbrusu novém výkonném čipu RP2350. Má vyšší taktovací frekvenci jádra, dvojnásobné množství paměti SRAM na čipu, dvojnásobné množství paměti flash na desce, výkonnější ARM jádra, volitelná RISC-V jádra, nové bezpečnostní funkce a vylepšené možnosti propojení.
articles.title: Raspberry Pi Pico 2 má výkonnější procesor a dvakrát více paměti

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Mozilla oznámila, že Puppeteer, knihovna pro automatizaci a testování, nyní podporuje Firefox pomocí protokolu WebDriver BiDi. Nástroj Puppeteer lze použít k řízení testovacích instancí prohlížeče a běžně se používá pro automatizované testy webových stránek.
articles.title: Puppeteer přidal podporu pro Firefox

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Ať už horečně hledáte levnou cestu k postavení hového počítače, nebo jen chcete upgradovat stárnoucí kopii Office, tato kolekce nabídky od Goodoffer24.com vám pomůže. Jejich ceny jsou opravdu neuvěřitelné, tak na co čekat?
articles.title: Oficiální cena za Windows 11 Pro je €259 avšak Goodoffer24 účtuje jen €20

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přehled červencových vydání Jaderných novin: stav vydání jádra, citáty týdne a seznam článků týkajících se jádra.
articles.title: Jaderné noviny – přehled za červenec 2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Řízení rizik může zpomalovat inovace, včetně zavádění AI. Konica Minolta se zaměřila na ochranu firemních dat. Teplotu elektroniky by mohly měřit neutrony, přesně a rychle. Nekonečně velká ochrana stojí nekonečně velké peníze. Průzkum Acronis hlásí 293% nárůst e-mailových útoků.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Teplotu elektroniky by mohly měřit neutrony, přesně a rychle

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 32/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Jak umělá inteligence pomáhá s průzkumem Marsu. Při zapamatování a vybavování se mozkové vlny šíří opačným směrem. Průlom ve vývoji ultrarychlých luminiscenčních materiálů. Kvantové tornádo má zlepšit naše chápání černých děr.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Data z CERNu dále omezují podmínky pro dlouho žijící supersymetrické částice

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Energetika a vodárenství zaznamenaly čtyřnásobné zvýšení průměrných nákladů na obnovu po ransomwaru. Technologie baterií (5): Vědci znovu zkusili baterie s vodou jako elektrolytem. Kam se v AddAI posunuli a kam směřují. Ness představuje Matrix, nástroj na efektivní agilní vývoj. Gordic představil nástroj pro signalizaci rizik u podepisovaných elektronických dokumentů.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Energetika a vodárenství zaznamenaly čtyřnásobné zvýšení průměrných nákladů na obnovu po ransomwaru

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 31/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: V Berkley Lab otevřeli cestu k syntéze prvku 120. Stopy života by se mohly dát najít i u povrchu Europy a Enceladu. Pokročilá teorie informace odhaluje příčiny extrémních jevů (nejen) v počasí. Problém posledního parseku ukazuje souvislost mezi supermasivními černými děrami a temnou hmotou.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Pozoroval změnu chování magnetických momentů v antiferomagnetu

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Ať už horečně hledáte levnou cestu k postavení hového počítače, nebo jen chcete upgradovat stárnoucí kopii Office, tato kolekce nabídky od Goodoffer24.com vám pomůže. Jejich ceny jsou opravdu neuvěřitelné, tak na co čekat?
articles.title: Získejte ve slevové akci Back to School Windows 10 jen za €20 a Office za €12, Windows 11 za €20

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Studie analyzuje chlazení kapalinami v datových centrech využívaných pro AI. Red Hat zjednodušuje diverzifikaci úloh v hybridním cloudu. Technologie baterií (4): Vědci se pokoušejí o baterie lithium–kov pomocí nanostruktur. Generativní umělou inteligenci si v příštích dvou letech osvojí 85 % vývojářů softwaru. Kyberútoky jsou propojené s nedostatkem dovedností.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Studie analyzuje chlazení kapalinami v datových centrech využívaných pro AI

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Nanočástice mají odhalit limity rozsahu kvantového světa. Astronomové potvrdili nejbližší středně těžkou černou díru. Kde se třese Mars? Překonán český rekord ve výdrži ve vzduchu.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Jak chutná a jak voní ve vesmíru

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: ClamAV (Wikipedie), tj. multiplatformní antivirový engine s otevřeným zdrojovým kódem pro detekci trojských koní, virů, malwaru a dalších škodlivých hrozeb, byl vydán ve verzi 1.4.0.
articles.title: ClamAV 1.4.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Ruská prokuratura požaduje zákaz distribuce počítačové hry Last Train Home (ProtonDB Platinum), kterou vyvinulo brněnské studio Ashborne Games. Hra o československých legionářích podle ruských úřadů podněcuje nenávist vůči vládě v Moskvě a vojákům Rudé armády.
articles.title: Ruská prokuratura požaduje zákaz distribuce počítačové hry Last Train Home

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Na Kickstarteru běží kampaň na podporu zařízení CrowView Note aneb notebooku bez procesoru a paměti aneb přenosného monitoru s klávesnicí. Objednat si lze i rozšiřující desky pro snadné připojení Raspberry Pi 5 a Jetson Nano Dev Kit.
articles.title: CrowView Note

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Gentoo Linux končí s podporou architektury IA-64 (Itanium). Ta byla v upstreamu odstraněna v Linuxu 6.7.
articles.title: Gentoo Linux končí s podporou architektury IA-64 (Itanium)

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Batocera.linux byl vydán ve verzi 40. Jedná se o retro herní linuxovou distribuci.
articles.title: Batocera.linux 40

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Společnost SiFive dnes ohlásila výkonný až 256jádrový RISC-V procesor SiFive Performance P870-D. Dostupný by měl být do konce roku.
articles.title: SiFive Performance P870-D

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová verze 1.23 programovacího jazyka Go (Wikipedie). Přehled novinek v poznámkách k vydání.
articles.title: Go 1.23

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Před třemi týdny představené Apple Maps na webu už oficiálně běží také ve Firefoxu. Linux je ale pořád ignorován.
articles.title: Beta verze Apple Maps na webu už také ve Firefoxu

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Google uvedl na český trh telefony Pixel 9 (Pixel 9, Pixel 9 Pro a Pixel 9 Pro XL), hodinky Pixel Watch 3 a sluchátka Pixel Buds Pro 2.
articles.title: Google uvedl na český trh telefony Pixel 9, hodinky Pixel Watch 3 a sluchátka Pixel Buds Pro 2

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: E-shop CZC.cz končí. Přesouvá se na Allegro.
articles.title: E-shop CZC.cz končí. Přesouvá se na Allegro

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Red Hat engineers have been developing Ramalama as a new open-source project that hopes to "make AI boring" by this inferencing tool striving for simplicity so users can quickly and easily deploy AI workloads without much fuss...
articles.title: Red Hat Developing Ramalama To "Make AI Boring" By Offering Great AI Simplicity & Ease Of Use

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With the AMD Ryzen 9 9900X and Ryzen 9 9950X Linux review out of the way yesterday, today's benchmarking of the Ryzen 9000 series is looking closely at the AVX-512 performance impact. With the Ryzen 9000 series the Zen 5 cores have a full 512-bit data-path compared to the "double pumped" 256-bit data path found in the Zen 4 processors as well as the Strix Point SKUs. In this article is an AVX-512 enabled versus disabled comparison for not only the Ryzen 9 9950X but also the prior generation Ryzen 9 7950X and looking too at the CPU power use, thermals, and peak frequency when engaging a variety of AVX-512 workloads.
articles.title: Quantifying The AVX-512 Performance Impact With AMD Zen 5 - Ryzen 9 9950X Benchmarks

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: After talking about AmpereOne for the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure since last year, earlier this month Oracle finally announced general availability on their OCI Ampere A2 instances for tapping into these latest-generation Ampere Computing AArch64 server processors in the public cloud. Here's a brief look at the OCI Ampere A2 performance with AmpereOne compared to their prior A1 instances powered by Ampere Altra.
articles.title: AmpereOne Performance In The Cloud With Oracle Cloud A2

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: A set of patches posted today on the AMD graphics driver mailing list begin implementing support for process isolation within the AMDGPU kernel graphics driver...
articles.title: AMD Implementing Process Isolation Support For Their GPU/Accelerator Driver

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel engineers on Wednesday released the Linux NPU Driver v1.6 release for this for this MIT-licensed user-space mode driver support for the Neural Processing Unit (NPU) found since the Core Ultra Series 1 "Meteor Lake" SoCs and currently supporting the upcoming Lunar Lake and Arrow Lake processors as well. This Intel Linux NPU Driver in user-space interfaces with their iVPU kernel accelerator driver for making a nice open-source and upstream NPU software stack on Linux systems...
articles.title: Intel Linux NPU Driver 1.6 Released For Meteor Lake, Arrow Lake & Lunar Lake

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: For Ubuntu 24.04 LTS, Canonical released Netplan 1.0 as their declarative network configuration software spanning now from servers to desktops. In time for Ubuntu 24.10 due out in two months, Netplan 1.1 has been released as the next iteration of this Linux networking configuration software from Canonical...
articles.title: Canonical's Netplan 1.1 Improves Compatibility With Proton VPN & Microsoft's Azure Linux

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Mesa 24.2 is out today as stable for this quarterly feature release to these open-source OpenGL and Vulkan drivers used commonly on Linux systems and other platforms...
articles.title: Mesa 24.2 Released With New Vulkan Extensions, New Shader Cache

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Gentoo Linux was one of the last few Linux distributions continuing to maintain Itanium (IA-64) architecture builds but that is now being phased out for those discontinued Intel processors...
articles.title: Gentoo Linux Ending Itanium IA-64 Support

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Last Wednesday was the review embargo for the Ryzen 5 9600X and Ryzen 7 9700X Zen 5 desktop processors that proved to be very exciting for Linux workloads from developers to creators to AVX-512 embracing AI and HPC workloads. Today the review embargo lifts on the Ryzen 9 9900X and Ryzen 9 9950X and as expected given the prior 6-core/8-core tests: these new chips are wild! The Ryzen 9 9900X and Ryzen 9 9950X are fabulous processors for those engaging in heavy real-world Linux workloads with excellent performance uplift and stunning power efficiency.
articles.title: AMD Ryzen 9 9950X & Ryzen 9 9900X Deliver Excellent Linux Performance

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: SiFive today lifted the lid on the P870-D, its new RISC-V processor dor data center and AI workloads. The P870-D is designed to scale up to 256 cores while supporting modern features like CXL and other AI/HPC minded features...
articles.title: SiFive Announces P870-D For Up To 256 RISC-V Cores

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Next month AMD will be providing an update on their long-term strategy for open-source firmware. Central to their open-source firmware plans is their OpenSIL effort that remains in development for eventually replacing AGESA on future generations of Ryzen and EPYC platforms...
articles.title: AMD To Provide Update On Long-Term Strategy For Open-Source Firmware

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: A new driver has been posted for better supporting the Corsair VOID gaming headsets under Linux...
articles.title: New Linux Driver Supports Corsair VOID Gaming Headsets

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The first alpha release of the Weston 14.0 reference Wayland compositor is now available with a handful of new features...
articles.title: Weston 14.0 Alpha Brings New Wayland Compositor Features

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While Linus Torvalds called for including the "sched_ext" extensible scheduler in Linux 6.11, he ultimately decided not to merge it for Linux 6.11 after some technical issues were raised on the Linux kernel mailing list...
articles.title: New Linux Kernel Patches Better Prepare For sched_ext

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The BeOS-inspired Haiku open-source operating system is out with their latest status update that highlights various improvements made in recent weeks...
articles.title: Haiku OS R1 Beta 5 Approaching Soon, New Performance Improvements

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel published a number of new CPU microcode images this Patch Tuesday for addressing various security issues as well as a number of functional issues being addressed across different CPU client and server processor generations...
articles.title: Intel Publishes Updated CPU Microcode For A Variety Of Security & Functional Issues

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel Linux graphics driver engineers today sent in their first batch of patches to DRM-Next of new material they are prepared to introduce with the upcoming Linux 6.12 kernel cycle...
articles.title: Intel Begins Queuing Kernel Graphics Driver Changes For Linux 6.12

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Back in May the folks at Framework Computer announced Framework Laptop 13 support for the Intel Core Ultra Series 1 (Meteor Lake) alongside announcing a new 2.8K 120Hz display option, a new web camera upgrade, and new colors for their expansion cards. Today marks the review embargo expiration with the hardware now shipping. Here's my initial look at the Intel Core Ultra Series (Meteor Lake) within the confines of the modular and upgradeable Framework Laptop 13.
articles.title: Framework Laptop 13 With Intel Core Ultra Series, 2.8K 120Hz Display

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: In addition to the ASUS ROG Ally X revision of this handheld gaming console having more (and faster) system memory, doubling of the battery capacity, upgraded storage, improved cooling, and other refinements over the original ROG Ally gaming handheld, there is a different audio amplifier. In turn a Linux kernel patch is needed to fix-up the audio support on the ASUS ROG Ally X as well as needing to fetch a new firmware binary...
articles.title: ASUS ROG Ally X Audio Support Being Fixed Up Ahead Of Linux 6.12

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Hitting the release button minutes ago, AMDVLK 2024.Q3.1 is available as the newest version of AMD's official open-source Vulkan driver and the first new release since the end of June. This driver continues to trail in popularity to the likes of the Valve-backed Mesa RADV Radeon Vulkan driver but does well in areas like Vulkan ray-tracing and is officially backed by AMD...
articles.title: AMDVLK 2024.Q3.1 Brings Official Ubuntu 24.04 Support & New Performance Tuning

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Miracle-WM as a reminder is a Wayland tiling window manager that is built atop Canonical's Mir. Miracle-WM also happens to be developed by a Canonical engineer,  Matthew Kosarek. Miracle-WM is inspired by i3 and Sway but the main difference is turning to Mir to do the heavy lifting. Miracle-WM 0.3.1 was released on Monday as the project prepares for its Fedora Miracle Spin debut coming up...
articles.title: Mir-Based Miracle-WM Updated Ahead Of Fedora Miracle Spin

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Yesterday was a fresh sync of the Asahi Linux projecr's AGX Gallium3D and Honeykrisp drivers to the upstream Mesa 24.3-devel Git repository. Some 42 patches are now upstream in Mesa for benefiting OpenGL and Vulkan atop Apple Silicon graphics...
articles.title: Apple Silicon OpenGL & Vulkan Drivers Updated In Mesa 24.3 Git

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: FEX 2408 has been released as the newest update to this open-source emulator that allows for running x86/x86_64 games and application binaries on AArch64 (64-bit ARM) systems. There are some nice improvements to find with FEX 2408 while already the next release is being teased for even greater performance...
articles.title: FEX 2408 Emulator For x86_64 Binaries On AArch64 Teases More Performance

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Ubuntu 24.04.1 LTS was scheduled to ship this week but has now been delayed to the end of August in order to address some high profile upgrade bugs...
articles.title: Ubuntu 24.04.1 LTS Delayed To End Of Month

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: A new version of Eclipse OpenJ9 is now available for this high performance Java Virtual Machine (JVM)..
articles.title: Eclipse OpenJ9 v0.46 Released For High Performance JVM

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With all the craze around "AI" and hoping to foster more open-source AI models, the Linux Foundation has welcomed the Open Model Initiative (OMI) into its umbrella of open-source initiatives to help foster high quality, openly-licensed AI models...
articles.title: Linux Foundation Looks To Become More Involved With AI Models, Welcomes OMI

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Going back four years ago Intel engineers worked out bus lock detection for the Linux kernel to benefit their processors able to detect bus locks and then notify the kernel, given the negative performance implications associated with bus locks. That Intel support was merged in Linux 5.13 back in 2021 while now AMD has their equivalent ready for mainlining in the Linux kernel...

articles.author: Shawn Robinson
articles.description:
Each week in Destiny 2 brings a new Nightfall mission and a weapon to grind the god roll for. This is the go-to for most endgame players as you get access to some very strong Adept weapons sporting some fantastic perks.


One such weapon has a unique god roll thanks to its archetype, and it only comes around ever so often. Here's the god roll for the Undercurrent grenade launcher in Destiny 2.


The best perks and attachments for the Undercurrent in Destiny 2


Image via Destructoid.


The Undercurrent is part of the Wave Frame archetype of grenade launchers, which means the grenades it shoots send out a wave when they hit the ground. This damages all enemies in a line and makes the weapon great for ad clear. However, this also means the iconic build of running Disorienting Grenades, Auto-Loading Holster, and Vorpal Weapon doesn't work. However, the following build does nicely:



Launcher Barrel: Quick Launch


Magazine: High-Velocity Rounds


Perk 1: Demolitionist


Perk 2: Voltshot



Quick Launch lets you get that shot out from the Undercurrent much faster, giving better weapon ready speed and projectile speed for a good combination. High-Velocity Rounds expands on that, giving you an even faster reload and projectile speed for follow-up shots. Demolitionist makes for a great flow between regenerating your grenade charge, throwing it out, and then repeating the process with a reloaded grenade launcher. Finally, there's Voltshot, which seriously improves the ad clear potential through jolt.


If running this with a grenade build isn't your forte, then Ambitious Assassin is a great alternative perk, provided you can get several kills with one grenade. You could also run Lead from Gold to seriously improve your ammo economy.

The post Destiny 2 Undercurrent god roll – Best perks and attachments appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Destiny 2 Undercurrent god roll – Best perks and attachments

articles.author: Steven Mills
articles.description:
Paradox Interactive announced today that the new Stellaris: Cosmic Storms expansion for the sci-fi strategy game is set to launch via PC on September 10, 2024. The new expansion brings new technologies and edicts to respond to the new Cosmic Storm threat as well as the all-new Storm Chaser origin and two new precursor stories.




While storm systems already exist in Stellaris, the new Cosmic Storms expansion adds 8 new types of Cosmic Storms that replace the existing Space Storms and randomly spawn across the map. The new Cosmic Storms are Electric, Particle, Gravity, Magnetic, Radiant, Stardust, Shroud, and Nexus. The storms will automatically grow, shrink, and change speeds as they work their way across the galaxy.


Alongside the storms is the new Storm Chaser Origin, an empire of people that seek to push themselves beyond their own limits. As such, they strive for enlightenment by engaging with the new fierce Cosmic Storms that the universe sends at them.


With the new Storm Chaser Origin comes three new civics: Astrometeorology, Storm Devotion, and Environmental Architects. There are also two new precursor stories that discover the stories of the Ancients, vanished masters of the storms: Weather Manipulators and the adAkkaris Convention of Benevolence. Completing each narrative will unlock a new relic.


Stellaris: Cosmic Storms will be released on PC via Steam on September 10, 2024, at the price point of $12.99. It's part of the Season 8 Season Pass and will also be added to the monthly Expansion Subscription for Stellaris.

The post New Stellaris expansion Cosmic Storms sweeps across the galaxy in September appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: New Stellaris expansion Cosmic Storms sweeps across the galaxy in September

Screenshot by Destructoid


At the top is Kylian Mbappé. He is a French player who has 99 OVR with a value of €136 million. His stats are very impressive, even as a left-winger. Also, he practically has greater finishing ability than Nico Williams, who is the second-top player on the list.

99

articles.author: Shawn Robinson
articles.description:
Destiny 2's Salvation's Edge raid weapons are all rather unique, if not in function then definitely in appearance. Each one is about as weird as the visuals of the raid itself, not that this makes them any less powerful.


Among them is a new sword that, while not including Eager's Edge, has a rather potent DPS combo for certain boss fights: The Summum Bonum.


Here's the god roll for the Summum Bonum sword in Destiny 2.


The best perks and attachments for the Summum Bonum in Destiny 2


Image via Destructoid.


The Summum Bonum sword sports the highly sought-after Wave Frame archetype, allowing its heavy attacks to send out a wave in front of you. This gives your sword a little range if you either get pushed back or are still approaching the enemy. The following perks and attachments should pair nicely with it:



Blade: Hungry Edge


Guard: Balanced Guard


Perk 1: Relentless Strikes


Perk 2: Chaos Reshaped



Hungry Edge immediately provides max sword ammo, which is something swords tend to struggle a lot with. Any buff there helps a ton. Balanced Guard gives a much better guard, though you shouldn't worry about ittoo much since you won't be using it. Relentless Strikes is where things get interesting since it gives back sword ammo on continuous light swings---which you'll be doing many of. Finally, we have Chaos Reshaped, increasing damage based on how long you're in combat. A great buff for boss DPS.


How to get the Summum Bonum in Destiny 2


The Summum Bonum comes from the new Salvation's Edge raid. It can drop from the second encounter (Herald of Finality), the fourth encounter (Verity), or the fifth one (The Witness). On top of this, the object that appears after defeating The Witness lets you spend 20 Spoils of Conquest to get a deepsight version of whatever weapon you want, including the Summum Bonum. Getting five of these grants you the ability to craft it.

The post Destiny 2 Summum Bonum god roll – Best perks and attachments appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Destiny 2 Summum Bonum god roll – Best perks and attachments

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
The Alexandra Popp FUTTIES and Ivan Cordoba FUTTIES cards are now live in EA FC 24, and finally, you can obtain them in Ultimate Team. 


To make matters even better, you can get both items for free. The two cards are part of a latest objective set that revolves around the Champions Finals game mode. Let's take a look at how to get both special items for your squad. 


EA FC 24 Alexandra Popp FUTTIES and Ivan Cordoba FUTTIES objective


The latest objective set has seven different tasks, and some of them can be completed only in the finals. 



Play 6: Play 6 matches in any Champions Game Mode.


Play 10: Play 10 matches in any Champions Game Mode.


Play 13: Play 13 matches in any Champions Game Mode.


Play 16: Play 16 matches in any Champions Game Mode.


Play 30: Play 30 matches in any Champions Game Mode.


Win 5 - FUTTIES: Win 5 matches in Champions Finals while having min. 7 FUTTIES players in your starting 11.


Win 10 - FUTTIES: Win 10 matches in Champions Finals while having min. 7 FUTTIES players in your starting 11.



Here's how you can obtain the two FUTTIES card. 



Ivan Cordoba Heroes: Just play 30 complete games in any Champions mode. This includes Finals and Playoff games. 


Alexandra Popp: Complete all seven tasks as she's the group reward. 



This objective set is really easy to complete. You get a total of 40 Champions Finals games and 30 Playoffs games to complete the objective. Just make sure your starting lineup has at least seven FUTTIES items. 

The post EA FC 24: How to get Alexandra Popp FUTTIES and Ivan Cordoba FUTTIES for free appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: EA FC 24: How to get Alexandra Popp FUTTIES and Ivan Cordoba FUTTIES for free

articles.author: Daniel Morris
articles.description:
Skills are the bread and butter of Old School RuneScape. The gameplay loop of Jagex's iconic MMO revolves around the dopamine hit of seeing your skills and XP go up. The slow crawl to 99 is excruciating, but there's nothing quite like the moment all your hard work pays off. 


We've separated our Old School RuneScape Skills Tier List into two different categories: free-to-play and members. The game's paid content is so much more in-depth that it's difficult to directly compare the two. That's not to say OSRS isn't worth trying for free: It's still a classic MMORPG, but you'll have a lot more fun with the skills as a paying member.


Image via Jagex


Free-to-Play Old School RuneScape Skills Tier List


Most Old School RuneScape players dip their toes into the game as a free-to-play user. T…
articles.title: Old School RuneScape skills Tier List: All OSRS skills, ranked

articles.author: Joseph Luster
articles.description:
The Wholesome Games Steam event is here to announce new games and spotlight current releases, and one of today's reveals is Ritual of Raven. This witchy farming sim comes from Spellgarden Games, who previously worked on Sticky Business. It's currently due out through publisher Team17 sometime in 2025.


Beyond Steam, Ritual of Raven is eyeing a release on Nintendo Switch. Spellgarden is aiming for maximum coziness with this one, as previewed in the announcement trailer below.




Ritual of Raven describes itself as a farming sim, but you actually collect and enchant Arcana Constructs to work on your magical herb garden for you. While these magical creatures help grow ingredients for rituals, it's up to you to embark upon quests, befriend various characters, and get to tradin'. You'll also want to suss out what's up with all these portals that have been popping up throughout the land.


If the crux of your coziness lies in customization, it seems there's plenty of it to go around here. You can decorate your farm as you see fit, and you can also apply a bunch of customization options to the wider world of magic beyond your farm's borders.


Enchanting ingredients


Screenshot via Team17


So far, it all looks like it's eyeing a nice balance between chill sim gameplay and a touch of mystery lurking around the edges. If you want to try it out for yourself and happen to be heading to gamescom, Ritual of Raven will be playable at the event. Look for the demo at the Indie Arena Booth in Hall 10.2 | F010 E019 for all your occult-adjacent cultivating needs.  

The post Ritual of Raven is a witchy farming sim from the Sticky Business devs appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Ritual of Raven is a witchy farming sim from the Sticky Business devs

It’s worth noting that this is not an update intended to bring more features to the game, such as those mentioned in the Early Access roadma…
