articles.author: Kristina Ebanez
articles.description:
During the Undercover R&B episode, you'll take control of Version 1.1's newest up-and-coming character, Jane Doe. She's on a secret mission involving the Mountain Lion Gang, where she eventually stumbles upon a locker that requires a code. To get you back on track, we'll show you the correct passcode in Zenless Zone Zero's Undercover R&B Special Episode.


Zenless Zone Zone Undercover R&B six-digit code, explained


According to the note near the locker, clues can be found throughout the room to determine the correct passcode. More specifically, it mentions how frequently shown numbers are the key to solving this puzzle. If you look at the piece of paper in the office, you'll see that the six-digit code 101225 appears the most, which is the correct passcode to the ZZZ Undercover R&B episode.


If you're having trouble entering this room, you can go through the gates on the right side of the counter. However, some players have indicated that these gates wouldn't allow access. In this case, restart the game and try to go through it again to fix the issue.


Screenshot by Destructoid


Once the locker opens, head to the equipment room and grab the master keycard. The path from here is relatively straightforward, but you'll still need the Port Peak videotape to satisfy the gangster's request. You can find it in the Proxy's main hub at Random Play.


Although the Proxy will take point at this stage, you'll play as Jane Doe again in the next phase. It's the perfect chance to get familiar with her combat and movement, as she will appear as a banner in the second half of Zenless Zone Zero Version 1.1.

The post What is the passcode in Zenless Zone Zero Undercover R&B episode? appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: What is the passcode in Zenless Zone Zero Undercover R&B episode?

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
If you and your friends have the dream of managing NFL teams, Madden NFL 25's Franchise mode is the perfect option to test yourselves (albeit on the virtual platform).


I love playing the Franchise mode as a solo journey, where I am up against the AI managers. But there's an option to conduct a league between you and your friends, where each of you takes charge of a franchise. Let's take a look at the exact steps of setting up a multiplayer league and how your friends can join them.


How to create a multiplayer league with Madden NFL 25 Franchise mode


Creating a multiplayer league in Madden NFL 25 isn't very different from a solo league.



Open and load the game.


Select Franchise.


Go to League Creation and pick the second option.


Select the franchise of your choice.


Proceed to the next stage to open league settings. Here, you can tweak different settings, including making it public or private (password-protected).






To play with your friends, make sure to create a private league. The maximum number of users is 32. Next, note down the league name and password and share it with your friends.


If you or your friend want to join a league, they can do so from the Franchise mode as well. They will have to enter the league name and password to join the league. Once they're in, they can pick a franchise of their liking and continue with the different aspects of management.


That's pretty much it when it comes to playing Franchise mode with your friends. Just make sure to coordinate and decide who's picking which franchise so there's no quarrel about it later.

The post How to play Madden NFL 25 Franchise mode with your friends appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to play Madden NFL 25 Franchise mode with your friends

articles.author: Steven Mills
articles.description:
Developer BioWare and publisher Electronic Arts released an all-new trailer for the upcoming RPG Dragon Age: The Veilguard today that showed glimpses of what to expect from the first title in the series in almost a decade. The focus of the trailer, however, was to indicate when we can expect to get our hands on The Veilguard: October 31, 2024.




Even though we've had to wait almost 10 years to get back to Dragon Age, the wait is almost over. With a Halloween 2024 release date that means we're just 2.5 months away from getting our hands on Dragon Age: The Veilguard.


Surely not coincidentally, the story in The Veilguard takes place a decade after the events of its predecessor, Dragon Age: Inquisition. Players will take on the role of Rook and his companions as they put an end to a ritual in progress by Solas, one of your allies and party members from Inquisition who has become a villain. However, doing so breaks free the corrupt Elven gods who are hellbent on blighting the world, and it's now up to you and your party to fight back against the ancient rulers.


For those interested in freshening up on their Dragon Age lore and knowledge, all of the Dragon Age games are currently on sale for 90% off on all platforms through August 19 as part of the ongoing Electronic Arts August sale.

The post Dragon Age: The Veilguard pits us against corrupt Elven Gods this Halloween appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Dragon Age: The Veilguard pits us against corrupt Elven Gods this Halloween

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Pounce Light has announced that its free-form scene creator, Tiny Glade, now has a release date. It’s hitting PC on September 14, 2024.


Tiny Glade (I keep writing “Grove”) is a cozy game where you construct little buildings using an impressively intuitive editor. There’s no judgement (no “wrong answers” as the developer says), so the goal is to simply create scenes that please you. Maybe pet the sheep while you’re at it.




The unique hook here is its editor. It’s not grid-based, and features that you place adapt to being morphed. The structure adapts to objects placed, such as windows, so it’s all about plopping and dragging. It’s a game that really sells itself because even watching the trailer and the gifs on the store page is satisfying. 


I’m someone whose mind has been polluted enough by modernity that I feel the need to have some sort of progression, and it doesn’t look like Tiny Glade has that, but the creation kit alone has me wanting to play it. Considering the fact that poor life choices have practically ensured that I will never own a home of my own, the idea of being able to easily create one from my imagination is appealing.


Tiny Glade had an impressive demo this past May’s Steam Next Fest. Paula Vaynshteyn gave it a look and came away with a craving for more.


We won’t have to wait long, as Tiny Glade launches on PC September 14, 2024.

The post Cozy scene-building game Tiny Glade is out in September appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Cozy scene-building game Tiny Glade is out in September

Steam has been the head honcho of the digital PC gaming world pretty much since it came out, around 20 years ago. Of course, in order to stay ahead of the curve, it needs to be vigilant about how it allows game developers to operate on its platform.

These changes will be rolling out in "early September," so devs have a bit of time to make any alterations to their own product description pages.




The rules will affect the "About the Game," "Short Description," "Special Announcement," and "Awards" sections, and are as follows:



No links to other websites - This means that you cannot use your store page …
articles.title: Steam is changing what devs can and cannot put in game descriptions

articles.author: Andrew Heaton
articles.description:
The Nintendo Switch is very nearly at the end of its life cycle. It's had a pretty successful run, being a vehicle for Animal Crossing: New Horizon, Tears of the Kingdom, Super Mario Bros. Wonder, and many more. Not to mention, it picked up a lot of the slack from the lackluster Wii U. But what of its follow-up?


Well, many of us have been anticipating a launch of the Switch 2 (as it's being referred to currently), with some expecting it to launch maybe at the end of this year. However, that idea seems out of reach now.


Image via The New Yorker.


According to a recent report from Eurogamer – which has corroborated information with the likes of GamesIndustry.biz – the Switch sequel may not see the light of day until later in calendar year 2025. Developers have reportedly been told to not expect it until after the end of the financial year, which would be April at the earliest.


Nintendon't do this to us...


Look, we know it's happening. That's just a given. Rumors about the Nintendo Switch 2 have been inbound for a good while now, and Nintendo itself has confirmed there's a successor on the way.


The Eurogamer article goes on to speculate that we could be looking at a Switch-esque announcement, which was revealed in October 2016, and was subsequently released in March the following year.


Whether this is the plan is anybody's guess at this stage. But it feels like we're so on the cusp of receiving official word on the elusive Nintendo Switch 2, if Nintendo's plans to announce news this fiscal year hold true. It also means that – if the rumors are true – then we can wave goodbye to any hopes of getting the new console in time for Christmas 2024.

The post Nintendo Switch 2 might not launch until April 2025 at the earliest appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Nintendo Switch 2 might not launch until April 2025 at the earliest

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
Devolver Digital and All Possible Futures have officially announced that The Plucky Squire will launch on PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and Nintendo Switch on September 17. After two years of sneak peeks and gameplay trailers, this is the exact time you can dive into this cute storybook adventure.




The announcement trailer also comes with a story introduction and some brief, polished gameplay elements to hype up the fun.


The Plucky Squire's charm comes from its colorful, cartoonish art style and the swaps between 2D and 3D gameplay. Playing as the protagonist of our fairytale story, Jot, you'll set off on a magical adventure alongside friends to return to your book and defeat the story's villain, Humgrump. As Humgrump kicks you out of the story and throws the land of Mojo into chaos, you'll have to find your way back in while using the "real" world and the book's features to save the day.


The game also features a peculiar shift in art as you swap from 2D to 3D, with the former having a simplistic, cartoonish style and 3D changing to a more realistic approach. I became interested in The Plucky Squire when it was first announced in 2022, and the more I hear about it, the more fascinated I am by its adorable yet slightly bizarre gameplay elements. I don't normally love platformers, but I'm curious to give this one a shot. 


The Plucky Squire will be available on September 17, 2024, for PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and Nintendo Switch.

The post Dimension-swapping adventure The Plucky Squire sets off this September appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Dimension-swapping adventure The Plucky Squire sets off this September

articles.author: Jamie Moorcroft-Sharp
articles.description:
The Iron Rig is the second piece of paid DLC for Dredge and might be its biggest expansion to date. It tasks you with signing up to work for a new company in the game, but it's not quite as simple as you might think. If you want to get anywhere with them, you'll need to put in the legwork. 


Once you've downloaded The Iron Rig DLC, it'll immediately impact your game. Dredge's world becomes filled with mysterious crates belonging to the Ironhaven company. You can dredge them up and stick them in storage, but eventually, you'll need to do something with them. That's not possible until you find the new location, though. It's not wise to turn up without upgrading your boat and completing some of the story first, though. 


How to find and start The Iron Rig in Dredge


Screenshot by Destructo…
articles.title: How to find and start The Iron Rig in Dredge

articles.author: Filip Galekovic
articles.description:
It's almost hard to believe it's been such a long time coming, but Skyblivion is still well on its way to hit its targeted 2025 release window. If you have any doubts, the brand-spanking-new 20-minute gameplay video showing off Skyblivion quests is almost guaranteed to clear them right up.


Mirroring last year's 20-minute gameplay showcase almost to a T, the latest Skyblivion gameplay video is all about those classic TES 4: Oblivion side-quests that many of us know and love. The two featured quests, specifically, are the Killing Fields and Fingers of the Mountain, and the gameplay shown off here is bound to send you for a nostalgic loop if you remember playing the Bethesda classic back in the late aughts.






Watch 20 minutes of brand new Skyblivion questing gameplay


News about Skybli…
articles.title: Skyblivion shows off a new batch of classic quests for a top tier nostalgia trip

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Headware Games has announced that their anticipated PS2-style horror game Hollowbody will release on PC September 12.


Hollowbody has you play as a woman who crashlands into an exclusion zone set around and abandoned British city. She’s looking for someone there, but finding them suddenly isn’t her biggest problem. There are both monsters and puzzles about, and safety is beyond the wall.




The aesthetic and framework are based on ‘00s horror games. The best horror games. While much of the indie horror scene has focused on PS1-style, ‘90s horror was a bit goofy. When we got to the ‘00s, we seemed to hit a sweet spot of hardware horsepower and team sizes. We got games like Silent Hill 2, Fatal Frame, and Rule of Rose. The gameplay could sometimes be stiff, and the combat (especially in those games I just named) was often garbage, but they were invariably interesting.


What I’m saying is that there’s a diminished focus on combat and more on atmosphere and puzzle-solving. There’s also a mix of dynamic and fixed camera angles. It definitely looks the part.


I’ve had my eye on Hollowbody for a while. I had the demo installed since a Steam Next Fest and only uninstalled it in an ongoing struggle to manage the shrinking free territory on my hard drive. So, I didn’t actually play the demo since I thought I’d wait until the full release. That would have made this article easier to write since I’d have more intimate familiarity with the game. I try my best.


Hollowbody releases for PC on September 12, 2024.

The post PS2-inspired psychological horror Hollowbody releases next month appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: PS2-inspired psychological horror Hollowbody releases next month

articles.author: Sourav Banik
articles.description:
Augments are the newest introduction to the Zombies mode in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6. These will provide you with in-depth customization options for multiple items and here's how it works.


Black Ops 6 is the upcoming iteration in the Call of Duty franchise and its Zombies mode has already become quite popular. Thanks to Treyarch, the game mode is packed with features including Augments, Equipment, Perk-a-Colas, and more.


But what are these Augments and how do they work? To answer your question, we've got everything you need to know.


Image via Activision


How do Black Ops 6 Augments work?


As per Call of Duty's official blog, Augments will provide "a rich and innovative customization experience." This will allow you to research the best Perks, Ammo Mods, and Field Upgrades to use i…
articles.title: All Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Zombies Augments, explained

articles.author: Filip Galekovic
articles.description:
Dead Island 2 was pretty dang good on day one, back in 2023, but it's only been getting better still from that point onwards. Specifically, the upcoming Patch 6 promises to round off the game's selection of modes and activities with New Game+, Neighborhood Watch mode, and a lot more.


This news comes directly from the developer, Dambuster, with the company announcing its plans for Dead Island 2's Patch 6 on Steam. Now, Dambuster did promise a few months ago that Dead Island 2 fans would have much to look forward to in the coming months, and the team is now delivering not just with the hotly anticipated New Game+ option, but also the all-new survival Neighborhood Watch mode, where players need to team up and defend a frat house from an ever-growing horde of zombies.




Image via Dambuster…
articles.title: Dead Island 2 announces Neighborhood Watch mode, New Game+, and more

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
With every Monopoly GO Partners event comes opportunities to get thousands of dice, wild stickers, and exclusive board tokens not found anywhere else. However, you'll also need thousands of event tokens to score points, which can be difficult to obtain if you're new to the game or don't know all their spawn methods.


How to find free Monopoly GO Rocket Partners event tokens


There are four ways to get Rocket Partners point tokens in Monopoly GO:



Participate in banner events and tournaments.


Land on point tokens around your Monopoly board.


Complete daily Quick Wins objectives.


Redeem free shop gifts.



While free gifts give you a few dozen tokens daily, Quick Wins offer over 200, with events and tournaments rewarding thousands if you complete their prize tiers. Tokens on your bo…
articles.title: How to get free Rocket Partners event tokens in Monopoly GO

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Sam & Max is something that I love and I wish it was more popular. However, I know that if it actually did become more popular, I’d probably become fatigued quite quickly and stop loving it as much. Sometimes we don’t know what’s good for us.


However, it has been 14 years since the last Sam & Max adventure. Unless you count 2021’s Sam & Max: This Time It’s Virtual, which I don’t because my eyes have not yet been tainted by VR. That last time was Telltale’s Sam & Max: Season 3: The Devil’s Playhouse, which is the last game in Skunkape Games’ remastering effort.


Back when it launched, I really dug into Season 3. I was enraptured, but because of its episodic nature, I got halfway through the third episode before losing momentum and never finishing the rest. So, I was happy to get a reason…
articles.title: Review: Sam & Max: The Devil’s Playhouse

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
Each passing month introduces a new Monopoly GO Partners event, with August 2024 marking the celebration of another space-themed week. With this week comes several themed events, including the debut of Rocket Partners and its numerous reward tiers. With thousands of dice and a Wild Sticker on the line, there's a lot to explore this time around.


All Rocket Partners event rewards in Monopoly GO


Monopoly GO's Partners events are unique, and Rocket Partners is no exception, with it only having five reward tiers and one grand prize. The fun part is that you can get each reward up to four times, allowing you to get over 10,000 dice if you're lucky. This time, we also have an exclusive board token and a Wild Sticker up for grabs. Here's the list of every Rocket Partners reward.


Event Milest…
articles.title: Monopoly GO: All Rocket Partners rewards and milestones

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
Monopoly GO's Rocket to Success banner event is part of reintroducing space themes in the game, starting alongside Rocket Partners. Although it's only a two-day affair, it's packed full of dice, sticker packs, and Partners event tokens to help you snowball your success.


Let's check out the list of Rocket to Success rewards.


All Rocket to Success event rewards in Monopoly GO


Monopoly GO's Rocket to Success event has 50 rewards to claim from now until August 17, 2024. It boasts a unique prize set for the next 48 hours, with the opportunity to get 19,435 dice, 4,730 Rocket Partners event tokens, and eight sticker packs. Here's the complete Rocket to Success reward list.

articles.title: Monopoly GO: All Rocket to Success rewards and milestones

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Cox Communications has filed a petition at the Supreme Court, requesting a review of a Fourth Circuit ruling that held the company liable for pirating subscribers. While the case is ultimately about service provider liability, the ISP stresses that the current verdict jeopardizes internet access for all Americans, and threatens to cause mass disruption across the internet.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Cox Asks Supreme Court to Protect Internet Subscribers from ‘Piracy Terminations’

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
After years of legal proceedings, New Zealand Justice Minister Paul Goldsmith has approved Kim Dotcom's extradition to the United States. The Megaaupload founder faces criminal copyright infringement, racketeering, and money laundering charges, which in theory could lead to decades in prison. Dotcom says he has a plan and doesn't intend to leave the country.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Kim Dotcom’s Extradition to the U.S. Given Green Light By New Zealand

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
In the unlikely event that there's anyone left in the UK who hasn't been completely desensitized to the perils of IPTV, here's another case to strain the nerves. After being raided five years ago, two brothers from Ilford in Essex have been sentenced to prison. Whether both will actually see the inside of a cell is unclear; one turned up to face the music, the other failed to appear. The reason for his absence is unknown and just the start of a long list of other unanswered questions.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Two IPTV Pirates Sentenced to Prison But After 5 Years Questions Remain

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Popular shadow library LibGen appears to be struggling with technical problems. Regular book downloads stopped working last weekend and remain unavailable. The reason for the issues are unknown but, for now, internal troubles at the site seem more likely than a copyright-related enforcement action.  
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Popular Shadow Library ‘LibGen’ Breaks Down Amidst Legal Troubles

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
File-hosting service Uptobox was taken offline last year following complaints from entertainment industry giants including Amazon, Disney, and StudioCanal. The platform's servers were targeted in a police raid just months after a French court ordered ISPs to block the site. Uptobox tried to reverse this decision, arguing that it's not the piracy haven rightsholders make it out to be, but the court denied that challenge.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Uptobox Bid to Resurrect File-Storage Service Fails in French Court

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Top tier French football leagues, Ligue 1 McDonald's and Ligue 2 BKT, have obtained a new court order to block dozens of pirate IPTV platforms. As presented on the Paris Judicial Court's website, the list of domains amounts to a wall of merged text simply asking to be misinterpreted. Fortunately they're more easily determined in the downloaded order, but that doesn't mean precision blocking won't be needed. Perhaps now more than ever, one mistake could go terribly wrong.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Top French Football Leagues Win Pirate IPTV Blocking Orders

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Ecuador's top football league, LigaPro, continues to fight the availability of pirate streaming services. Dozens of 'unauthorized' platforms are active, but MagisTV is seen as the main adversary. To combat this threat, dozens of new IP-addresses were blocked by Internet providers. Meanwhile, rightsholders caught a ball out of left field, successfully opposing a trademark application by MagisTV.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: ‘MagisTV’ Piracy Blocking Efforts in Ecuador Expand, Trademark Application Denied

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
On Russia's answer to YouTube, traffic has doubled in the last 12 months. RuTube is currently awash with pirated copies of Hollywood movies and, during the summer, RuTube used imagery from Barbie and Oppenheimer to advertise the fact. Last week, Russian telecoms operators gave RuTube another boost by massively throttling YouTube. On Friday, RuTube's apps were suddenly removed from Apple's App Store and Google Play.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: RuTube Embraces Piracy Then Vanishes From Apple’s App Store & Google Play

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Every week we take a close look at the most pirated movies on torrent sites. What are pirates downloading? 'Despicable Me 4' tops the chart, followed by 'Deadpool & Wolverine'. 'The Instigators' completes the top three.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Top 10 Most Pirated Movies of The Week – 08/12/2024

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Warner Music Group says it's building a world-class anti-piracy unit. As part of this quest, the company has a job opening for a new anti-piracy coordinator. Prospects will have to spot the latest piracy trends and find sites and services from where the latest leaks originate. Musical talent is not required, but independent and inquisitive prospects, with a strong attention to detail, are preferred. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Warner Music is Looking for an Anti-Piracy Expert to Monitor Leaks

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
The title of this article contains a question, one that in various forms has been asked millions of times over the years. The reason the same question still gets asked countless times even today, is simple: the answer, should one even exist, is never true for long, even if we assume it was initially true. So what's the harm in asking?
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: What’s the Safest & Most Trusted Site to Download Pirate Streaming Apps?

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
The Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC) has repeatedly taken a tough stance on piracy, condemning freeloaders and calling for tough enforcement measures. In a recent earnings call, UFC parent company TKO noted that ESPN price hikes haven't made things easier. On the contrary, the company directly links price increases to the "jacked up" piracy numbers.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: UFC Links Increase in Piracy Numbers to ESPN Price Hikes

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Serie A's bid to force Cloudflare to participate in Piracy Shield, Italy's pirate IPTV blocking system, has failed. The Italian football league filed a legal complaint in April, claiming that Cloudflare assists and protects pirate services. In a decision handed down this week, the Court of Milan said that it has no legal authority to compel Cloudflare to join the program. The Court also denied Serie A's application for an injunction, for reasons that suggest this battle may not be over.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Cloudflare Can’t Be Forced to Use Piracy Shield to Block IPTV, Court Tells Serie A

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
The IIPA, which represents the MPA, RIAA, and other entertainment industry groups, believes that Canada could and should do more to tackle online piracy. The association argues that anti-piracy efforts, in the broadest sense, should be prioritized. In addition, copyright exceptions that, by IIPA's standards, grant the public too much freedom, should be scrapped. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: U.S. Copyright Groups Urge Canada to Prioritize Anti-Piracy Enforcement

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
The continued rise of Japanese manga is accompanied by interesting facts, figures, and curiosities alike. Of all graphic novels sold in the U.S. during 2023, half were manga. Of those who consume manga digitally in Japan, the most prolific are the over 50s; half read manga every day. Estimates show that over 1,300 pirate sites offer manga and in a recent single month, 100 new pirate manga sites appeared online. Cost to the industry: $800m per month.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Japan vs. Manga Piracy: $800m Losses & 100 New Pirate Sites in One Month

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
When ISPs are instructed to block pirate sites, tampering with their own DNS records is often the weapon of choice. This type of blocking can be circumvented by switching to public DNS offered by companies including Cloudflare and Google. Tests carried on several ISPs in Malaysia this week reveal that requests to Cloudflare and Google public DNS servers are being hijacked and diverted to local ISP DNS servers.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: ISPs Hijack Cloudflare/Google DNS Requests, Ending Site-Blocking Workarounds

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
The RIAA and several other organizations condemn AI startup Anthropic for allegedly flaunting copyright law. The criticism appears in an amicus brief in support of a court injunction requested by music publishers, who want the AI company to stop using lyrics without permission. According to the RIAA, Anthropic's defense relies on the same rhetoric as Napster once did.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: RIAA Backs AI Copyright Lawsuit Against Anthropic, Sees Similarities with Napster

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Uruguay's Ministry of Industry issued a decree in October 2022 which heralded the country's first pirate site blocking program. Since then the country has blocked over 300 pirate domains following requests from various broadcasters. Some other figures of interest; in December 2022, there were around 573,000 pay TV subscribers in Uruguay. A year later that figure had fallen to 496,000. Pay TV revenues were less affected than one might expect.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Pirate Site Blocking Can’t Prevent Pay TV Subscriber Decline in Uruguay

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Internet provider Cox Communications wants a do-over of the piracy liability trial, where it was ordered to pay $1 billion in damages to the record label plaintiffs. The ISP previously argued that 'concealed' evidence warrants a new look at the case. According to the music companies, however, Cox is grasping at straws, relying on speculation in the hope of getting a do-over.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Record Labels Ask Court to Deny Cox’s Challenge of ‘$1 Billion’ Piracy Verdict
